newsitem.title: USA: NGPL limits natgas line deliveries to Sat.
newsitem.headline: NGPL limits natgas line deliveries to Sat.

text.p: Natural Gas Pipeline (NGPL) said Thursday it extended the "critical time" order on its Texas-Illinois gas pipeline through 1200 CST on Saturday, limiting gas deliveries due to the bitter cold in the Midwest.
"Critical time will be on until Saturday noon (1200 CST. They're going to meet Saturday morning to determine if it should be lifted or not," a company spokeswoman said.
NGPL's system runs via two main lines from western Texas, terminating in Illinois.

Critical time or critical day orders are typically declared by pipeline operators during periods of extreme cold to ensure customers buying firm transmission receive their gas and to avoid operational problems on the system. Withdrawals from the system that exceed nominated volumes incur a penalty.
